articles.author: FARNOUSH AMIRI and ERIC TUCKER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The House voted Friday to reauthorize and reform a key U.S. government surveillance tool following a dramatic showdown on the floor over whether the FBI should be restricted from using the program to search for Americans’ data.
articles.title: House passes reauthorization of key US surveillance program after days of upheaval over changes

articles.author: JENNIFER PELTZ
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Of the 1.4 million adults who live in Manhattan, a dozen are soon to become the first Americans to sit in judgment of a former president charged with a crime.
articles.title: Manhattan court must find a dozen jurors to hear first-ever criminal case against a former president

articles.author: GRAHAM LEE BREWER and AARON MORRISON
articles.description: For many people old enough to remember O.J. Simpson’s murder trial, his 1995 exoneration was a defining moment in their understanding of race, policing and justice. Nearly three decades later, it still reflects the different realities of white and Black Americans.
articles.title: In death, 3 decades after his trial verdict, O.J. Simpson still reflects America's racial divides

articles.author: ZEKE MILLER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Democratic donors covered more than $1 million in legal fees racked up by attorneys representing President Joe Biden in a yearlong special counsel probe into his handling of classified documents.
articles.title: Democratic donors paid more than $1M for Biden's legal bills for special counsel probe

articles.author: GEOFF MULVIHILL
articles.description: Developments this week in Arizona underscored something that was already apparent about the 2024 elections in the United States: Abortion is going to loom large as an issue in state and federal elections — including the presidential race — and directly in the form of referendums in some states.
articles.title: What to know about this week's Arizona court ruling and other abortion-related developments

articles.author: ACACIA CORONADO
articles.description: A suspect is in custody after a commercial vehicle crashed into a Texas Department of Public Safety office in a rural town west of Houston on Friday, seriously injuring several people, according the agency.
articles.title: Multiple injuries, arrest made after semitrailer crashes into public safety office in Texas

articles.author: PAUL WISEMAN, GISELA SALOMON and CHRISTOPHER RUGABER
articles.description: MIAMI (AP) — Having fled economic and political chaos in Venezuela, Luisana Silva now loads carpets for a South Carolina rug company. She earns enough to pay rent, buy groceries, gas up her car — and send money home to her parents.
articles.title: How immigrant workers in US have helped boost job growth and stave off a recession

articles.author: FRANK BAJAK
articles.description: As their rivalry intensifies, U.S. and Chinese military planners are gearing up for a new kind of warfare in which squadrons of air and sea drones equipped with artificial intelligence work together like a swarm of bees to overwhelm an enemy.
articles.title: US-China competition to field military drone swarms could fuel global arms race

articles.author: JONEL ALECCIA
articles.description: Drug regulators in Europe have found no evidence that popular diabetes and weight-loss drugs like Ozempic and Wegovy are linked to a higher risk of suicidal thoughts or actions. The European Medicines Agency regulatory committee announced the results of its review on Friday.
articles.title: No link between Ozempic, Wegovy and suicide, EU drug regulators say

articles.author: DOUG FEINBERG
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Caitlin Clark, Angel Reese, Cameron Brink and others make this one of the most anticipated WNBA drafts in recent years. There are several impact players up for grabs, but their talent is nearly eclipsed by their popularity among basketball fans.
articles.title: Caitlin Clark and Angel Reese headline one of the most anticipated WNBA drafts in years
